This message was automatically generated.

Thanks for working on this [~jhung], 
but java's foreach loop makes use of iterator internally and in general queue refresh is single threaded operation hence remove operation is also not a risk. But agree its generally good to use iterator and delete using the iterator. 
Hence i am ok with committing the patch but with reduced severity and also unmarking YARN-5556 as breaking this jira. Thoughts ?

Hi [~Naganarasimha], this actually broke some stuff I was testing in YARN-5952, I believe even with single threaded operation an iterator must be used if you want to remove elements from a map within a loop (e.g. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6092642/how-to-remove-a-key-from-hashmap-while-iterating-over-it), otherwise you can get {{ConcurrentModificationException}}.

Thanks for the clarification ! My Bad i was wrong....
Committing it ....
Thanks [~jhung] for your contributions, have committed the patch to trunk.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #11402 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/11402/])
